result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley J Sullivan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sixty days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. Submit DNA sample.

10:21 AM Defendant Bradley J Sullivan in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brenda L. Yaskal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Right to attorney, defendant would like to proceed prose. State to prepare an offer. Court in recess. 10:25/10:50 Court resumed, appearances the same. Court reviewed the waiver of right to attorney. Agreement recited by State. Court reviewed the rights & elements. Defendant pled guilty to count 1. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. Sentencing statements. $679.00 fine and costs. Submit DNA sample. Sixty days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. 2 days credit. 11:00 AM
Filed by DA Office - statement of A.G.
